content: This is probably a question as old as time itself (apologies in advance!) but could someone throw me a couple pointers as to maybe how I could find issues to work on i.e. what labels should I be using in GH issues and such? or should I join a working group or two and respond to pings?
Generally this depends on what you're interested in, but the E-easy label is a good start if you're looking for issues that don't require much in-depth knowledge of the compiler

Some other possible way to get started:

  • Working on one of the many other related projects (e.g. chalk if you're interested in traits). A list of working groups: https://rust-lang.github.io/compiler-team/working-groups/
  • You could join the ICE-breakers group, which requires very little context but is extremely useful: https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/ice-breaker/cleanup-crew.html
